item.title: 布林肯就自由问题暗讽中国后，习近平抵达美国
item.description:
U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken took a thinly veiled swipe at China on Tuesday on the eve of an Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) forum summit and the first face-to-face meeting between the U.S. and Chinese leaders in a year.翻译:周二，在亚太经合组织（APEC）论坛峰会以及中美领导人一年来首次面对面会晤前夕，美国国务卿安东尼·布林肯对中国进行了几乎不加掩饰的抨击。

Addressing a ministerial meeting of the 21-member APEC in San Francisco just before Chinese President Xi Jinping's arrival in the city, Blinken stressed the U.S. believed in "a region where economies are free to choose their own path ... where goods, ideas, people, flow lawfully and freely.”翻译:在中国国家主席习近平抵达旧金山之前，布林肯在由 21 个成员组成的旧金山亚太经合组织部长级会议上发表讲话时强调，美国相信“一个经济体可以自由选择自己道路的地区……在这里，商品、思想、人员合法、自由流动。”

Xi is on his first visit to the U.S. since 2017. He is due to meet U.S. President Joe Biden at an undisclosed location in the San Francisco Bay Area on Wednesday morning and then attend the APEC summit.翻译:这是习近平自2017年以来首次访问美国。他将于周三上午在旧金山湾区的一个秘密地点会见美国总统乔·拜登，然后出席亚太经合组织峰会。

The Biden-Xi meeting will be only their second in person since the U.S. president's inauguration in 2021 and has been billed by U.S. officials as an opportunity to reduce friction in what many see as the world's most dangerous rivalry.翻译:拜登与习近平的会面将是美国总统 2021 年就职以来的第二次面对面会面，美国官员称这是减少摩擦的机会，这场许多人认为这是世界上最危险的竞争。

Blinken did not mention China in his remarks, but his language echoed U.S. rhetoric in recent years in which Washington has accused China of bullying smaller countries in the Indo-Pacific and trying to undermine what the U.S. and its allies call the existing "rules-based" order.翻译:布林肯在讲话中没有提及中国，但他的语言呼应了美国近年来的言论，华盛顿指责中国欺凌印度-太平洋地区的小国，并试图破坏美国及其盟友所称的现有“基于规则的国际关系”。 “ 命令。

U.S. Trade Representative Katherine Tai, who with Blinken opened the APEC ministerial session, said the San Francisco meeting came at a time of "great uncertainty and challenges" for the region. She noted increasing geopolitical tensions, fragile supply chains and a worsening climate crisis.翻译:美国贸易代表戴凯瑟琳·戴 (Katherine Tai) 与布林肯一起宣布亚太经合组织部长级会议开幕，她表示，旧金山会议召开之际，该地区正面临“巨大的不确定性和挑战”。她指出，地缘政治紧张局势日益加剧，供应链脆弱，气候危机日益恶化。

Earlier, Biden said his goal in his talks with Xi would be to improve the relationship with China after a period of strained ties. He said he would seek to resume normal communications between the two superpowers, including military-to-military contacts.翻译:此前，拜登表示，他与习近平会谈的目标是在经历了一段紧张时期后改善与中国的关系。他表示，他将寻求恢复两个超级大国之间的正常沟通，包括军事接触。

White House national security spokesperson John Kirby told reporters Biden and Xi would also talk about the Israel-Hamas conflict in Gaza as well as U.S. efforts to support Ukraine in its battle to repel Russian invaders.翻译:白宫国家安全发言人约翰·柯比告诉记者，拜登和习近平还将谈论以色列与哈马斯在加沙的冲突，以及美国支持乌克兰击退俄罗斯入侵者的努力。

Economic issues will be high on the agenda.翻译:经济问题将成为议程的重点。

Biden said the U.S. does not want to decouple from China but wants to change the economic relationship for the better.翻译:拜登表示，美国不想与中国脱钩，但希望改善经济关系。

His administration has made a push to "de-risk" some critical U.S. supply chains from China as the two countries’ economic and military rivalry has grown.翻译:随着两国经济和军事竞争的加剧，他的政府已努力推动美国一些关键供应链从中国“消除风险”。

But it has been careful to assure countries in the region, including China, that the U.S. does not seek complete economic separation, a notion that has fueled concerns among Washington's partners and allies of a superpower showdown that would upend the global economy.翻译:但它一直小心翼翼地向包括中国在内的该地区国家保证，美国不会寻求完全的经济分离，这一想法引发了华盛顿的合作伙伴和盟友对超级大国摊牌的担忧，这将颠覆全球经济。

The Chinese severed military-to-military contacts with the U.S. after then-House of Representative Speaker Nancy Pelosi visited democratically governed but Chinese-claimed Taiwan in August 2022.翻译:2022 年 8 月，时任众议院议长南希·佩洛西访问民主治理但中国声称拥有主权的台湾后，中国切断了与美国的军事接触。

Restoring the contacts is a top U.S. goal to avoid miscalculations between the two militaries.翻译:恢复接触是美国的首要目标，以避免两军之间出现误判。

Relations between the two countries grew particularly frosty after Biden ordered the shooting down in February of a suspected Chinese spy balloon that flew over the United States.翻译:拜登二月份下令击落飞越美国上空的疑似中国间谍气球后，两国关系变得尤其冷淡。

Top Biden administration officials have since visited Beijing and met with their counterparts in an effort to rebuild communications and trust.翻译:此后，拜登政府高级官员访问了北京并会见了同行，以努力重建沟通和信任。

Several hundred mostly pro-China demonstrators carrying Chinese flags gathered outside the Chinese delegation’s hotel ahead of Xi’s arrival in the U.S.翻译:在习近平抵达美国之前，数百名手持中国国旗的示威者聚集在中国代表团下榻的酒店外，其中大部分是亲中国的

Larger protests, including by rights groups critical of Xi’s policies in Tibet, Hong Kong and toward Muslim Uyghurs, are expected to gather near the summit venue on Wednesday.翻译:预计周三峰会会场附近将举行更大规模的抗议活动，其中包括批评习近平在西藏、香港和穆斯林维吾尔人政策的人权组织的抗议活动。

As Biden arrived in San Francisco, shortly before Xi was due to land, dueling demonstrators greeted the U.S. president’s motorcade from the airport. Some waved Chinese flags and held banners calling for "kindly" and "warm" U.S.-Sino ties. Others held signs condemning the Chinese Communist Party (CCP).翻译:当拜登抵达旧金山时，就在习近平即将抵达之前不久，示威者在机场迎接美国总统的车队。一些人挥舞着中国国旗，举着呼吁“友好”和“温暖”的美中关系的横幅。其他人则举着谴责中国共产党的标语。

Earlier on Tuesday, a small aircraft flew circles over the APEC summit venue, trailing a banner that read "END CCP FREE CHINA FREE HK FREE TIBET FREE UIGHUR," referring to China's treatment of Uyghurs, which the Biden administration calls "genocide."翻译:周二早些时候，一架小型飞机在亚太经合组织峰会会场上空盘旋，机上悬挂着一条横幅，上面写着“结束中共、自由、香港、自由、西藏、自由维吾尔人”，指的是中国对待维吾尔人的方式，拜登政府称之为“种族灭绝”。

Reporting by Michael Martina, Ann Saphir and David Brunnstrom, Trevor Hunnicutt and David Lawder; Editing by Chris Reese and Josie Kao翻译:Michael Martina、Ann Saphir 和 David Brunnstrom、Trevor Hunnicutt 和 David Lawder 报道；编辑：Chris Reese 和 Josie Kao

item.title: 一些基金经理认为中国大幅折扣股票的优点
item.description:
After months of steering clear of China, global asset managers and hedge funds say they are seeing tentative signs of a recovery on the mainland and value in the country's depressed stock markets.翻译:在避开中国几个月后，全球资产管理公司和对冲基金表示，他们看到了中国大陆复苏的初步迹象以及该国低迷股市的价值。

While foreign inflows only point to a tepid commitment from these funds so far, the rhetoric is changing as asset managers point to volatility in U.S. stocks and sudden policy impetus in China as reasons to return to the country.翻译:虽然到目前为止，外资流入仅表明这些基金的承诺不温不火，但随着资产管理公司将美国股市的波动和中国突然的政策推动作为重返中国的理由，这种说法正在发生变化。

U.S. asset manager Fidelity International is highlighting China's looser monetary policy and the government's recent 1 trillion yuan ($137.10 billion) borrowing-and-spending sovereign bond plan as a tailwind for the country's stock markets.翻译:美国资产管理公司富达国际(Fidelity International)强调，中国宽松的货币政策和政府最近1万亿元人民币（合1,371亿美元）的借贷和支出主权债券计划是该国股市的推动力。

“There are mixed pictures if you look globally, depending on your own sort of risk tolerance. Now I think it might be a time to shift from the U.S. into China,” said Marty Dropkin, head of equities, Asia Pacific at Fidelity International.翻译:“如果你放眼全球，情况会是好坏参半，具体取决于你自己的风险承受能力。现在我认为可能是时候从美国转向中国了。”富达国际亚太区股票主管 Marty Dropkin 表示。

London-based £3 billion fund manager Somerset Capital Management likewise finds China exciting. Mark Williams, portfolio manager of its Asia Strategy, says easier monetary and fiscal policies have led to "attractive improvements in company earnings across our portfolio".翻译:总部位于伦敦、价值 30 亿英镑的基金管理公司萨默塞特资本管理公司同样对中国感到兴奋。其亚洲战略投资组合经理马克·威廉姆斯表示，宽松的货币和财政政策导致“我们投资组合中的公司盈利出现了引人注目的改善”。

The fund is increasing exposure to sportswear and electric vehicle companies that will benefit from growing consumer demand.翻译:该基金正在增加对运动服装和电动汽车公司的投资，这些公司将受益于不断增长的消费者需求。

Pessimism on China seems to have peaked this month as authorities in the world's second-largest economy announced bigger stimulus plans and state spending, and even measures to shore up the beleaguered property sector, though the developers' debt crisis may take years to untangle.翻译:随着世界第二大经济体当局宣布更大规模的刺激计划和国家支出，甚至采取措施支撑陷入困境的房地产行业，对中国的悲观情绪似乎在本月达到顶峰，尽管开发商的债务危机可能需要数年时间才能解决。

The stock market has yet to recover, but has stabilised. The MSCI China index (.dMICN00000PUS) is down 11% so far this year, while U.S. stock indexes S&P 500 (.SPX) and Nasdaq (.IXIC) are up 15% and 32%, respectively. Japan’s Nikkei (.N225) has gained 25%.翻译:股市尚未复苏，但已趋于稳定。 MSCI 中国指数(.dMICN00000PUS)今年迄今已下跌 11%，而美国股指标准普尔 500 指数(.SPX)和纳斯达克指数(.IXIC)分别上涨 15% 和 32%。日本日经指数(.N225)上涨 25%。

Morgan Stanley estimates long-only foreign investors now have their deepest underweight positions in China and Hong Kong equities in years. These funds have offloaded nearly $10 billion worth of Chinese equities in the past three months, the largest cumulative outflows since 2018, the bank said.翻译:摩根士丹利估计，只做多的外国投资者目前对中国和香港股市的减持程度是多年来最深的。该行表示，这些基金在过去三个月抛售了价值近100亿美元的中国股票，这是自2018年以来最大的累计流出量。

Chinese stocks have cheapened as a result, to a price-to-earnings ratio of 11%, the lowest among major Asian markets.翻译:中国股市的市盈率因此下跌至 11%，是亚洲主要市场中最低的。

Patrick Ghali, managing partner of Sussex Partners, a London-based hedge fund advisory, says clients who used to say "we don't want any allocation to China" are now thinking of contrarian entry points into the market and of re-engaging.

TURNING POSITIVE

Morgan Stanley data also shows a light turnaround in flows. Foreign investors bought $924 million of China A-shares via the Hong Kong-China Stock Connect link from Nov. 2 to 8, the first week of net inflows since the beginning of August.翻译:摩根士丹利的数据也显示资金流出现轻微好转。 11月2日至8日，外国投资者通过中港通买入9.24亿美元的中国A股，这是自8月初以来的第一周净流入。

The benchmark Hong Kong stock index (.HSI) has risen 1.7% this month after three consecutive months of losses, led by a surge in healthcare and tech shares. And, the Hang Seng Tech Index (.HSTECH) is up 5.1% so far in November.翻译:在医疗保健和科技股飙升的带动下，香港基准股指(.HSI)在连续三个月下跌后，本月上涨 1.7%。而且，恒生科技指数(.HSTECH) 11 月份迄今已上涨 5.1%。

The International Monetary Fund also upgraded its 2023 China economy growth forecast to 5.4% last week.翻译:国际货币基金组织上周也将2023年中国经济增长预期上调至5.4%。

Boston-based investment firm Cambridge Associates says some Middle East investors find China's cheap valuations alluring and are allocating money there.翻译:总部位于波士顿的投资公司Cambridge Associates表示，一些中东投资者发现中国低廉的估值很有吸引力，并正在那里配置资金。

Hong Kong-based hedge fund Triata Capital expects attractive risk-reward in internet and e-commerce giants, saying excess investor pessimism had distorted valuations.翻译:总部位于香港的对冲基金 Triata Capital 预计互联网和电子商务巨头将获得有吸引力的风险回报，称投资者过度悲观情绪扭曲了估值。

“Investors are under-appreciating the substantial upside within (AI-related) software and internet over the long-term,” said Sean Ho, chief investment officer of Triata Capital.翻译:Triata Capital 首席投资官 Sean Ho 表示：“从长远来看，投资者低估了（人工智能相关）软件和互联网的巨大优势。”

Hedge funds typically do not publicly reveal their positions, but disclose them to investors and distributors, through investor letters.翻译:对冲基金通常不会公开披露其头寸，而是通过投资者信函向投资者和分销商披露。

Vivek Tanneeru, portfolio manager at Matthews Asia, a San Francisco-based asset manager, said he maintains an overweight position on China in anticipation of a sentiment boost from improved consumer confidence and warmer U.S.-China relations.翻译:总部位于旧金山的资产管理公司Matthews Asia的投资组合经理Vivek Tanneeru表示，他维持对中国的增持立场，因为预计消费者信心改善和中美关系回暖将提振市场情绪。

Tanneeru is adding select industrial, travel services, and medical services companies to his portfolio.翻译:Tanneeru 正在将精选的工业、旅游服务和医疗服务公司添加到他的投资组合中。

Some analysts, however, do not expect the feel-good factors will last.翻译:然而，一些分析师预计这种良好的感觉不会持续下去。

Chinese stocks could see a short-term sentiment pick-up given foreign funds have such light positions in the market, said Redmond Wong, Greater China market strategist at Saxo Markets.翻译:盛宝市场(Saxo Markets)大中华区市场策略师雷德蒙德·黄(Redmond Wong)表示，鉴于外国基金在市场上的仓位如此之少，中国股市短期情绪可能会回升。

"But there are rising concerns about China's long-term productivity and growth strategies", he said, referring to the government's often stated priorities around governance and anti-corruption efforts.翻译:“但人们对中国的长期生产力和增长战略的担忧日益增加”，他指的是政府经常提出的围绕治理和反腐败工作的优先事项。

($1 = 7.2939 Chinese yuan renminbi)翻译:（1 美元 = 7.2939 人民币）

item.title: 美国高级议员在习近平会面前向拜登施压囚犯问题信函
item.description:
The chairman of the U.S. Senate Foreign Relations Committee urged President Joe Biden to use his upcoming meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping to push for the release of Americans detained for years in China, according to a letter seen by Reuters on Tuesday.翻译:路透社周二看到的一封信显示，美国参议院外交关系委员会主席敦促总统乔·拜登利用即将与中国国家主席习近平举行的会晤，推动释放在中国被拘留多年的美国人。

Democratic Senator Ben Cardin wrote to Biden to push for immediate freedom for Mark Swidan, Kai Li and David Lin, whom the U.S. government has classified as wrongfully detained in China. Republicans and other Democrats have also called for their release.翻译:民主党参议员本·卡丁写信给拜登，敦促立即释放被美国政府列为在中国错误拘留的马克·斯维丹、李凯和林大卫。共和党人和其他民主党人也呼吁释放他们。

Biden and Xi are holding talks around events at the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation forum in San Francisco, as the United States seeks to recover from a diplomatic crisis over its downing of a suspected Chinese spy balloon over the United States in February.翻译:拜登和习近平正在旧金山亚太经济合作论坛上就有关活动举行会谈，此时美国正在寻求从二月份在美国上空击落疑似中国间谍气球引发的外交危机中恢复过来。

"With the holiday season approaching, and the opportunity to start the New Year on a more positive note in bilateral U.S.-China relationships, I implore you to secure commitments from president Xi to release these Americans immediately," Cardin wrote.翻译:卡丁写道：“随着假期的临近，以及美中双边关系以更积极的方式开始新年的机会，我恳请您确保习主席承诺立即释放这些美国人。”

Cardin also asked for the release and safety of U.S.-based journalists' family members whom he said are missing, jailed or detained in China due to their connection to the journalists.翻译:卡丁还要求释放驻美国记者的家人并确保他们的安全，他说这些家人因与记者有联系而在中国失踪、被监禁或拘留。

Families of Americans the U.S. government has classified as wrongfully detained in China have also repeatedly urged the government to prioritize the release of their loved ones in talks with Chinese officials.翻译:被美国政府列为在中国错误拘留的美国人的家属也一再敦促政府在与中国官员的会谈中优先释放他们的亲人。

Katherine Swidan said she spoke to U.S. Ambassador to China Nicholas Burns about her son Mark over the weekend, but called the conversation "disappointing" because Burns would not say whether Biden would raise Mark’s name with Xi.翻译:凯瑟琳·斯维丹(Katherine Swidan)表示，她周末与美国驻华大使尼古拉斯·伯恩斯(Nicholas Burns)谈论了她的儿子马克(Mark)，但称这次谈话“令人失望”，因为伯恩斯不愿透露拜登是否会向习近平提及马克的名字。

"China only respects strength," she said, adding that she was frustrated because the Biden administration did not appear to have a plan to get U.S. detainees out of China.翻译:“中国只尊重实力，”她说，并补充说，她感到沮丧，因为拜登政府似乎没有计划将美国在押人员带出中国。

A State Department spokesperson commented that the department has no greater priority than the safety and security of U.S. citizens and noted that it continually raises wrongfully detained U.S. nationals during engagements with senior Chinese officials.翻译:美国国务院发言人评论说，该部门最优先考虑的莫过于美国公民的安全和保障，并指出，该部门在与中国高级官员接触时不断提及被错误拘留的美国公民。

China says such cases are handled according to law.翻译:中方表示，此类案件将依法处理。

item.title: 澳大利亚相信中国下个月将解除所有贸易封锁
item.description:
Australia said on Wednesday China could lift all its remaining trade blocks by next month as relations between the commodity trade partners stabilise and after Prime Minister Anthony Albanese's visit to Beijing earlier this month.翻译:澳大利亚周三表示，随着大宗商品贸易伙伴之间的关系稳定以及总理安东尼·阿尔巴内斯本月早些时候访问北京之后，中国可能会在下个月解除所有剩余的贸易封锁。

Albanese's government has taken credit for patching up ties with China since coming to office last year. China has lifted most trade blocks imposed amid a 2020 diplomatic dispute after Australia called for an inquiry into the origins of COVID-19.翻译:自去年上任以来，阿尔巴尼斯政府因修复与中国的关系而受到赞誉。在澳大利亚呼吁对 COVID-19 的起源进行调查后，中国取消了在 2020 年外交争端中施加的大部分贸易封锁。

"I remain very confident ... that by Christmas all of these trade impediments will be removed," trade minister Don Farrell told ABC Radio from San Francisco, where he is attending Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) meetings.翻译:“我仍然非常有信心……到圣诞节，所有这些贸易障碍都将被消除，”贸易部长唐·法雷尔在旧金山出席亚太经合组织（APEC）会议时告诉美国广播公司广播电台。

"And we will have restored that stable relationship that we want with our largest trading partner."翻译:“我们将与我们最大的贸易伙伴恢复我们想要的稳定关系。”

Farrell said he hoped to resolve the issues over lobster and beef, which related to bio-security rules, ahead of a meeting with Chinese counterpart Wang Wentao in San Francisco.翻译:法雷尔表示，他希望在旧金山与中国外长王文涛会面之前解决涉及生物安全规则的龙虾和牛肉问题。

Reporting by Renju Jose in Sydney. Editing by Sam Holmes.翻译:Renju Jose 悉尼报道。山姆·霍姆斯编辑。

item.title: 拜登在旧金山会见习近平时会发生什么
item.description:
U.S. President Joe Biden and Chinese President Xi Jinping will meet on Wednesday before a summit of the Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) forum in San Francisco, seeking to reduce friction in what many see as the world's most dangerous rivalry.翻译:美国总统乔·拜登和中国国家主席习近平将于周三在旧金山举行的亚太经济合作组织（APEC）论坛峰会之前会面，寻求减少许多人认为世界上最危险的竞争中的摩擦。

The leaders of the world's two largest economies have known each other for over a decade and have shared hours of conversation in six interactions since Biden's January 2021 inauguration. But they have met only once in person since then and Xi has not visited the United States since 2017 when Donald Trump was president.翻译:世界上最大的两个经济体的领导人已经认识十多年，自拜登 2021 年 1 月就职以来，他们已在 六次互动中进行了数小时的交谈。但自那以后他们只见过一次面，而且习近平自 2017 年唐纳德·特朗普担任总统以来就没有访问过美国。

What issues are they likely to discuss?翻译:他们可能会讨论哪些问题？

The White House says the aim of the summit, to be held at an unannounced location in the San Francisco Bay Area, is to boost communication to prevent an intense rivalry from veering into conflict. The meeting is expected to cover global issues from the conflict in the Middle East to Russia's invasion of Ukraine, North Korea's ties with Russia, Taiwan, human rights, artificial intelligence, as well as "fair" trade and economic relations.翻译:白宫表示，峰会将在旧金山湾区的一个未宣布的地点举行，其目的是加强沟通，防止激烈的竞争演变成冲突。会议预计将涵盖从中东冲突到俄罗斯入侵乌克兰、朝鲜与俄罗斯、台湾、人权、人工智能以及“公平”贸易和经济关系等全球问题。

Biden is expected to tell Xi that the U.S. remains committed to standing with its allies and partners in the Indo-Pacific, in the face of Chinese pressure against democratically governed Taiwan, which China claims as its own, and in the South and East China Seas. He will also express a specific commitment to the security of the Philippines, U.S. officials said.翻译:预计拜登将告诉习近平，面对中国对民主治理的台湾以及南海和东海施加的压力，美国仍然致力于与印太地区的盟友和伙伴站在一起。 。美国官员表示，他还将表达对菲律宾安全的具体承诺。

What deals can we expect?翻译:我们可以期待什么交易？

The White House says Washington is looking for specific outcomes and hopes to see progress in reestablishing military-to military ties with China and in combating the trade in the potent synthetic opioid drug fentanyl, the use of which has become a scourge in the United States. Any deal on fentanyl would likely mean Washington having to lift human rights sanctions on China's police forensic institute in return.翻译:白宫表示，华盛顿正在寻求具体成果，并希望在与中国重建军事关系以及打击强效合成阿片类药物芬太尼贸易方面取得进展，芬太尼的使用已成为美国的祸害。任何有关芬太尼的协议都可能意味着华盛顿必须取消对中国警察法医研究所的人权制裁作为回报。

Biden said on Tuesday his goal would be to resume normal communications with China, including military-to-military contacts.翻译:拜登周二表示，他的目标是恢复与中国的正常沟通，包括军事接触。

With elections in Taiwan in early 2024, political analysts expect China to seek U.S. assurances that it will do nothing to encourage pro-independence elements, while Xi will also be hoping to persuade Biden to ease up on tariffs and the export controls that aim to keep the most advanced semiconductors from being sent to China. In a separate dinner with business leaders, the Chinese president will also been looking to boost flagging investment by U.S. firms in China.翻译:随着 2024 年初台湾大选，政治分析人士预计，中国将寻求美国保证，不会采取任何措施鼓励台独分子，而习近平也希望说服拜登放松关税和出口管制，以保持台湾的独立。最先进的半导体被运往中国。在与商界领袖举行的另一场晚宴上，中国国家主席还将寻求提振美国公司在中国萎靡不振的投资。

The leaders may highlight plans to increase commercial flights between the two countries and policy experts said they could move to ease restrictions on journalist visas, which would be to the benefit of both sides.翻译:领导人可能会强调增加两国之间商业航班的计划，政策专家表示，他们可能会采取措施放松对记者签证的限制，这对双方都有利。

Biden is also expected urge China to use its influence with Iran to not broaden the conflict in the Middle East.翻译:预计拜登还将敦促中国利用其对伊朗的影响力，不要扩大中东冲突。

But no one is expecting a reset of the relationship or any grand bargain that will dramatically alter how the countries see each other. "We remain in an enduring period of competition and tension," said Richard Fontaine of Washington's Center for a New American Security. "There's not going to be any big breakthroughs, there won't be any real change in substance."翻译:但没有人期待两国关系的重新调整或任何重大谈判将极大地改变两国如何看待彼此。华盛顿新美国安全中心的理查德·方丹说：“我们仍处于竞争和紧张的持久时期。” “不会有任何重大突破，不会有任何实质性的变化。”

How will the meeting impact markets?翻译:此次会议将如何影响市场？

Market participants will keep a keen focus on the talks to gauge sentiment between the two governments.翻译:市场参与者将密切关注会谈，以衡量两国政府之间的情绪。

The 21 APEC members and the world beyond hope for an easing of U.S.-China tensions, and progress on that score would be viewed positively, but political analysts said any improvement in the mood could be only temporary. Elections in Taiwan early next year and the November 2024 U.S. presidential vote that could bring a return of Trump, promise a year fraught with uncertainty.翻译:亚太经合组织 21 个成员和全世界都对美中紧张局势的缓和以及在这方面取得的进展抱有积极的看法，但政治分析人士表示，情绪的任何改善都可能只是暂时的。明年初的台湾选举和 2024 年 11 月的美国总统大选可能会带来特朗普的回归，这将是充满不确定性的一年。

Reporting by David Brunnstrom and Michael Martina; Editing by Don Durfee and Grant McCool翻译:大卫·布伦斯特罗姆和迈克尔·玛蒂娜报道；唐·杜菲和格兰特·麦库尔编辑

item.title: 俄罗斯资源部长在新型导弹研发期间访问朝鲜
item.description:
A Russian delegation led by natural resources minister Alexander Kozlov is visiting Pyongyang, North Korean state media said on Wednesday, as the politically isolated state announced new progress in its banned ballistic missile programme.翻译:朝鲜官方媒体周三称，由自然资源部长亚历山大·科兹洛夫率领的俄罗斯代表团正在访问平壤，这个政治上孤立的国家宣布其被禁止的弹道导弹计划取得了新进展。

Kozlov arrived on Tuesday, as U.S. Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin met with U.N. member states enforcing the Korean War armistice in Seoul and said they were concerned that China and Russia are helping North Korea expand its military capabilities by enabling Pyongyang to evade U.N. sanctions.翻译:科兹洛夫于周二抵达，当时美国国防部长劳埃德·奥斯汀在首尔会见了执行朝鲜战争停战协定的联合国成员国，并表示他们担心中国和俄罗斯通过让平壤逃避联合国制裁来帮助朝鲜扩大军事能力。

Russia and North Korea were conducting talks on economy, science and technology, KCNA state media reported, without elaborating.翻译:据朝中社官方媒体报道，俄罗斯和朝鲜正在就经济、科学和技术进行会谈，但没有详细说明。

Kozlov told a reception that Russia wants to develop "substantial cooperation" with North Korea based on the agreements made by Russian President Vladimir Putin and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un when they met in September in Russia's far east, KCNA reported.翻译:据朝中社报道，科兹洛夫在招待会上表示，俄罗斯希望根据俄罗斯总统普京和朝鲜领导人金正恩九月在俄罗斯远东地区会晤时达成的协议，与朝鲜发展“实质性合作”。

He also cited North Korea's "full support" for Russia over regional and international issues, the report said.翻译:报道称，他还提到朝鲜在地区和国际问题上“全力支持”俄罗斯。

North Korea is in its final stages of preparation for the launch of a spy satellite, and appears to have received technical assistance from Russia, South Korea's intelligence agency said this month.

NEW MISSILE ENGINES

North Korean state media also reported on Wednesday that the country had successfully conducted static tests of "new-type high-thrust solid-fuel engines" for intermediate-range ballistic missiles (IRBMs).翻译:朝鲜官方媒体周三还报道称，该国已成功对中程弹道导弹（IRBM）的“新型高推力固体燃料发动机”进行了静态测试。

"The test provided a sure guarantee for reliably accelerating the development of the new-type IRBM system," KCNA said.翻译:朝中社称：“这次测试为可靠地加速新型中程弹道导弹系统的开发提供了可靠的保证。”

North Korea's General Missile Bureau attached great significance to the new IRBM, saying the recent tests are essential for enhancing the strategic offensive capabilities of the military in light of "the grave and unstable security environment facing the country" and the "vicious" collusion of its enemies, KCNA added.翻译:朝鲜导弹总局高度重视新型中程弹道导弹，称鉴于“国家面临的严峻且不稳定的安全环境”以及朝鲜半岛核力量的“恶性”勾结，最近的试验对于增强军队的战略进攻能力至关重要。朝中社补充道，“敌人”。

Military analysts say solid-fuel missiles are easier and safer to operate, and require less logistical support, making them harder to detect and more survivable than liquid-fuel weapons.翻译:军事分析人士表示，固体燃料导弹操作起来更容易、更安全，并且需要较少的后勤支持，这使得它们比液体燃料武器更难被发现，生存能力更强。

This year North Korea tested its first solid-fuel intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM) - the largest category of ballistic missile - and also uses the technology in a range of smaller weapons.翻译:今年，朝鲜测试了其首枚固体燃料洲际弹道导弹（ICBM）——最大的弹道导弹类别——并且还在一系列小型武器中使用了该技术。

North Korea's missile programme, as well as its nuclear weapons, have been banned by U.N. Security Council resolutions, which imposed sanctions on the country.翻译:联合国安理会决议禁止朝鲜的导弹计划及其核武器，并对朝鲜实施制裁。

Washington has accused North Korea of supplying military equipment to Russia for use in its war with Ukraine, and Moscow of providing technical military support to help North Korea.翻译:华盛顿指责朝鲜向俄罗斯提供军事装备用于其与乌克兰的战争，并指责莫斯科提供技术军事支持来帮助朝鲜。

North Korea and Russia have denied any arms deals, though their leaders pledged closer military cooperation at their September summit.翻译:朝鲜和俄罗斯否认有任何武器交易，尽管两国领导人在九月峰会上承诺加强军事合作。

Reporting by Hyunsu Yim and Josh Smith, Editing by Grant McCool翻译:Hyunsu Yim 和 Josh Smith 报道，Grant McCool 编辑

item.title: 拜登称习主席会晤的目标是恢复美中军事沟通
item.description:
U.S. President Joe Biden said on Tuesday his goal during talks with Chinese President Xi Jinping this week is to resume normal communications between the two superpowers, including military-to-military contacts.翻译:美国总统乔·拜登周二表示，他本周与中国国家主席习近平会谈的目标是恢复两个超级大国之间的正常沟通，包括军事接触。

Speaking to reporters at the White House before departing for San Francisco, Biden said he is trying to alter the U.S. relationship with China for the better, after a period of strained ties.翻译:拜登在启程前往旧金山之前在白宫对记者表示，在经历了一段时间的紧张关系后，他正试图让美中关系变得更好。

Biden and Xi are to meet on Wednesday in the San Francisco area during the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation summit. It will be only the second in-person meeting between the two leaders since Biden took office in January 2021.翻译:拜登和习近平将于周三在旧金山地区亚太经济合作组织峰会期间会面。这将是拜登 2021 年 1 月上任以来两国领导人的第二次面对面会晤。

Asked how he would measure success at the talks with Xi, Biden said:翻译:当被问及如何衡量与习近平会谈的成功时，拜登说：

"To get back on a normal course, corresponding and being able to pick up the phone and talk to one another in a crisis, and being able to make sure that our militaries still have contact with one another."翻译:“为了回到正常轨道，在危机中能够相互通信并能够拿起电话互相交谈，并能够确保我们的军队仍然彼此保持联系。”

Aboard Air Force One en route to San Francisco, White House national security spokesperson John Kirby told reporters Biden and Xi would also talk about the Israel-Hamas conflict in Gaza as well as U.S. efforts to support Ukraine in its battle to repel Russian invaders.翻译:白宫国家安全发言人约翰·柯比告诉记者，拜登和习近平还将谈论以色列与哈马斯在加沙的冲突，以及美国支持乌克兰击退俄罗斯入侵者的努力。翻译:白宫国家安全发言人约翰·柯比在飞往旧金山的空军一号上告诉记者，拜登和习近平还将讨论以色列与哈马斯在加沙的冲突，以及美国支持乌克兰击退俄罗斯入侵者的努力。

"They can be frank and forthright with one another, I fully expect that that will be the case," Kirby said.翻译:“他们可以彼此坦诚和直率，我完全希望情况会如此，”柯比说。

He said Biden is "not going to be afraid to confront where confrontation is needed on certain issues where we don't see eye-to-eye" but also will look for areas to cooperate on such as climate change.翻译:他表示，拜登“不会害怕在某些我们意见不一致的问题上需要对抗的地方”，而且还将寻找在气候变化等领域进行合作的领域。

Economic issues figured to be high on the agenda.翻译:经济问题被提上议程。

Biden said the United States does not want to decouple from China but wants to change the economic relationship for the better.翻译:拜登表示，美国不想与中国脱钩，但希望改善经济关系。

He said it would benefit all if the average citizen in China had a decent-paying job.翻译:他表示，如果中国普通公民拥有一份体面的工作，这将使所有人受益。

"But I'm not going to continue to sustain support for a position where in order to invest in China, we have to turn over all our trade secrets," he said.翻译:“但我不会继续支持为了在中国投资，我们必须交出所有商业秘密的立场，”他说。

The Chinese severed military-to-military contacts with the United States in a fit of pique after then-House of Representative Speaker Nancy Pelosi visited Taiwan in August 2022.翻译:2022 年 8 月，时任众议院议长南希·佩洛西访问台湾后，中国一怒之下切断了与美国的军事联系。

Restoring the contacts is a top U.S. goal to avoid miscalculations between the two militaries.翻译:恢复接触是美国的首要目标，以避免两军之间出现误判。

Relations between the two countries grew frosty after Biden ordered the shooting down in February of a suspected Chinese spy balloon that flew over the United States.翻译:拜登二月份下令击落飞越美国上空的疑似中国间谍气球后，两国关系变得冷淡。

But top Biden administration officials have since visited Beijing and met with their counterparts to rebuild communications and trust.翻译:但拜登政府高级官员此后访问了北京，并与同行会面，以重建沟通和信任。

Reporting by Andrea Shalal, Steve Holland and Trevor Hunnicutt; Editing by Grant McCool翻译:Andrea Shalal、Steve Holland 和 Trevor Hunnicutt 报道；格兰特·麦库尔编辑
item.author: Trevor Hunnicutt, Andrea Shalal

item.title: 早间竞标：在美国软着陆希望的推动下登上月球
item.description:
A look at the day ahead in Asian markets from Jamie McGeever, financial markets columnist.翻译:金融市场专栏作家杰米·麦克吉弗 (Jamie McGeever) 对亚洲市场未来一天的展望。

Asian markets open on Wednesday with stocks, risk assets and investor sentiment around the world soaring after cooling U.S. inflation data on Tuesday looked to close the door on more rate hikes and pave the way for the fabled economic 'soft landing'.翻译:亚洲市场周三开盘，全球股市、风险资产和投资者情绪飙升，周二美国通胀数据降温，似乎关闭了进一步加息的大门，并为传说中的经济“软着陆”铺平了道路。

Some of Tuesday's U.S. market moves were eye-popping - two- and five-year bond yields plunged more than 20 basis points; the Nasdaq rose more than 2%; the Russell 2000 index rose 5% for its best day in a year; the dollar fell 1.5% for its worst day in a year; and the Aussie and New Zealand dollars both leaped 2%.翻译:周二美国市场的一些走势令人瞠目结舌——两年期和五年期债券收益率暴跌超过20个基点；纳斯达克指数上涨超过2%；罗素 2000 指数上涨 5%，创一年来最好单日涨幅； 美元下跌1.5%，创下一年来最糟糕的一天；澳元和新西兰元均上涨 2%。

This should be rocket fuel for Asia on Wednesday, although there is no shortage of event risk.翻译:尽管不乏事件风险，但这应该是周三亚洲的火箭燃料。

Top-tier data releases include third quarter Japanese GDP and Chinese retail sales, industrial output, investment and unemployment figures for October, while U.S. and Chinese Presidents Joe Biden and Xi Jinping meet at the Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation forum in San Francisco.翻译:顶级数据发布包括日本第三季度GDP和中国10月份零售额、工业产出、投资和失业数据，同时美国和中国国家主席乔·拜登和习近平在旧金山举行的亚太经济合作论坛上会面。

Biden and Xi have only met once before, and this is Xi's first visit to the U.S. since 2017. Xi is hoping to persuade Biden to ease up on tariffs and export controls aimed at keeping the most advanced semiconductors from being sent to China.翻译:拜登和习近平此前只见过一次面，这是习近平自2017年以来首次访问美国。习近平希望说服拜登放松关税和出口管制，以阻止最先进的半导体输往中国。

In a separate dinner with business leaders, he will also be looking to boost flagging investment by U.S. firms in China. Foreign investors have pulled huge sums out of China this year as the economy has faltered and tensions with the West have deepened.翻译:在与商界领袖举行的另一场晚宴上，他还将寻求提振美国公司在中国萎靡不振的投资。今年，随着中国经济步履蹒跚、与西方的紧张关系加剧，外国投资者已从中国撤出巨额资金。

Ahead of their talks, China's yuan climbed to a three-month high of 7.25 per dollar on Tuesday, rising around 0.5% for its biggest one-day gain in two months.翻译:在会谈之前，人民币兑美元汇率周二攀升至三个月高位7.25，上涨约0.5%，创两个月来最大单日涨幅。

The latest retail sales, industrial output, investment and unemployment figures for October will give an insight into whether China's economy is maintaining the surprisingly strong momentum it showed in the third quarter.翻译:10月份最新的零售销售、工业产出、投资和失业数据将让我们了解中国经济是否保持了第三季度令人惊讶的强劲势头。

Citi's China economic surprises index has been in positive territory for almost a month, suggesting activity is strengthening or analysts are lowering their expectations. Or a bit of both.翻译:花旗中国经济意外指数近一个月来一直处于正值，表明经济活动正在加强或分析师正在降低预期。或者两者兼而有之。

Japan's economic surprises index, on the other hand, just slumped into negative territory and is the lowest since June. The first reading of third quarter GDP on Wednesday could lift it again - the bar would appear low enough.翻译:另一方面，日本经济意外指数刚刚跌至负值，为 6 月以来的最低水平。周三公布的第三季度 GDP 初值可能会再次提升——这个标准似乎足够低。

Economists reckon the economy contracted 0.1% from the April-June period and shrank 0.6% on an annualized basis. That would represent a significant slowdown from growth rates of 1.2% and 4.8%, respectively, in the previous quarter.翻译:经济学家估计，经济较 4 月至 6 月期间收缩 0.1%，年化收缩 0.6%。这将比上一季度分别 1.2% 和 4.8% 的增长率显着放缓。

The corporate focus in Asia on Wednesday turns to the third quarter earnings reports from China's JD.Com and Tencent Holdings. JD.Com is expected to report a 2.3% increase in revenue to CNY249.258 billion and CNY5.77 earnings per share.翻译:周三亚洲企业的焦点转向中国京东和腾讯控股的第三季度收益报告。京东预计营收增长 2.3%，至 2,492.58 亿元人民币，每股收益 5.77 元人民币。

Here are key developments that could provide more direction to markets on Wednesday:翻译:以下是周三可能为市场提供更多方向的关键进展：

item.title: 报告称，尽管有新规定，中国仍接收美国设备来制造先进芯片
item.description:
Chinese companies are buying up U.S. chipmaking equipment to make advanced semiconductors, despite a raft of new export curbs aimed at thwarting advances in the country's semiconductor industry, a congressional report said on Tuesday.翻译:国会报告周二称，尽管一系列新的出口限制旨在阻碍中国半导体行业的进步，但中国公司仍在购买美国芯片制造设备来制造先进的半导体。

The 741 page annual report, released by the House of Representative's bipartisan select committee on China, takes aim at the Biden administration's Oct. 2022 export curbs, which seek to bar Chinese chipmakers from getting U.S. chipmaking tools if they would be used to manufacture advanced chips at the 14 nanometer node or below.翻译:众议院两党中国特别委员会发布的这份长达 741 页的年度报告瞄准了拜登政府 2022 年 10 月的出口限制措施，该措施旨在禁止中国芯片制造商获得用于制造先进芯片的美国芯片制造工具在14纳米节点或以下。

With the Commerce Department using the 14 nanometer restriction limit, "importers are often able to purchase the equipment if they claim it is being used on an older production line, and with limited capacity for end-use inspections, it is difficult to verify the equipment is not being used to produce more advanced chips," the report stated.翻译:由于商务部使用 14 纳米限制，“如果进口商声称该设备用于较旧的生产线，则通常能够购买该设备，但由于最终用途检查能力有限，因此很难验证该设备不会被用来生产更先进的芯片，”报告指出。

The finding comes as the United States scrambles to figure out how Chinese telecoms giant Huawei was able to produce an advanced 7 nanometer chip to power its Mate 60 Pro smartphone at China's top chipmaker SMIC, despite the export curbs announced last year.翻译:这一发现发布之际，美国正忙于弄清楚中国电信巨头华为如何能够在中国顶级芯片制造商中芯国际生产先进的 7 纳米芯片，为其 Mate 60 Pro 智能手机提供动力，尽管去年宣布了出口限制。

Huawei and SMIC were also added to a trade restriction list in 2019 and 2020, which in theory bars U.S. suppliers from shipping certain technology to the companies.翻译:华为和中芯国际还于2019年和2020年被列入贸易限制名单，理论上禁止美国供应商向这些公司运送某些技术。

China watchers had theorized that SMIC could have made the chip with equipment obtained prior to the October 2022 rules, but it had other options for obtaining the equipment from oversees, the report shows.翻译:报告显示，中国观察人士推测，中芯国际本可以使用 2022 年 10 月规定之前获得的设备来制造芯片，但它还有其他选择从海外获取设备。

The United States managed to plug a key loophole in its efforts to stymie China's access to advanced chipmaking tools by convincing allies Japan and the Netherlands, with similarly robust chipmaking equipment industries, to announce their own restrictions on exports of the coveted technology.翻译:美国成功地堵住了阻止中国获得先进芯片制造工具的一个关键漏洞，说服了拥有同样强大芯片制造设备行业的盟友日本和荷兰宣布对令人垂涎的技术的出口实施限制。

But China stockpiled equipment by taking advantage of the lagtime between the United States' October 2022 rules, and Japan and the Netherlands' similar moves in July and September of 2023 respectively, the report details.翻译:但报告详细介绍，中国利用美国 2022 年 10 月规定与日本和荷兰分别于 2023 年 7 月和 9 月采取类似举措之间的滞后时间囤积设备。

According to the document, between January and August 2023, China imported $3.2 billion (RMB 23.5 billion) worth of semiconductor manufacturing machines from the Netherlands, a 96.1% increase over the $1.7 billion (RMB 12 billion) recorded over the same period in 2022. China's imports of semiconductor equipment from all countries totaled $13.8 billion (RMB 100 billion) over the first eight months of 2023, it added.翻译:该文件显示，2023年1月至8月，中国从荷兰进口了价值32亿美元（235亿元人民币）的半导体制造设备，比2022年同期的17亿美元（120亿元人民币）增长了96.1%。报告补充称，2023年前8个月，中国从各国进口的半导体设备总额达138亿美元（1000亿元人民币）。

The report does not outline a specific recommendation to address the gaps in the U.S. rules, but urges Congress to request an annual evaluation, to be completed within 6 months by the General Accountability Office and later made public, of the effectiveness of export controls on chipmaking equipment to China.翻译:该报告没有概述解决美国规则缺陷的具体建议，但敦促国会要求对芯片制造出口管制的有效性进行年度评估，由总问责办公室在 6 个月内完成并随后公布。设备运往中国。

item.title: 美国将采取行动赢得中国在芬太尼方面的合作
item.description:
U.S. President Joe Biden's administration is set to remove restrictions on China's Institute of Forensic Science in a bid to convince Bejing to step up cooperation to halt the flow of the synthetic opioid fentanyl in the United States.翻译:美国总统乔·拜登政府将取消对中国法证科学研究所的限制，以说服北京加强合作，阻止合成阿片类药物芬太尼在美国的流动。

Blocking fentanyl "precursor" chemicals has been a priority for Washington as the rate of overdose deaths involving the drug more than tripled from 2016 through 2021, according to the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).翻译:根据美国疾病控制与预防中心 (CDC) 的数据，从 2016 年到 2021 年，涉及芬太尼“前体”化学品的过量死亡率增加了两倍多，因此封锁芬太尼“前体”化学品一直是华盛顿的首要任务。

Biden will discuss the issue with China's President Xi Jinping on Wednesday in San Francisco at the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) forum.翻译:拜登将于周三在旧金山举行的亚太经济合作组织（APEC）论坛上与中国国家主席习近平讨论这一问题。

U.S. National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan said on Tuesday that Washington hoped the summit would result in action to help combat the fentanyl trade. A source familiar with plans said the U.S. was ready to remove restrictions on the Institute of Forensic Science, part of China's Ministry of Public Security.翻译:美国国家安全顾问杰克·沙利文周二表示，华盛顿希望峰会能够采取行动，帮助打击芬太尼贸易。一位熟悉计划的消息人士称，美国准备取消对中国公安部司法鉴定所的限制。

Washington put the institute on the Commerce Department's "entity list" in 2020 over alleged abuses toward Uyghurs and other minority groups - effectively barring it from receiving U.S. exports. China has long questioned why the U.S. would expect cooperation on fentanyl while targeting the institute.翻译:华盛顿因涉嫌虐待维吾尔族和其他少数群体而于 2020 年将该研究所列入美国商务部的“实体名单”，这实际上阻止了该研究所接收美国出口产品。中国长期以来一直质疑美国为什么会在针对该研究所的同时期待芬太尼方面的合作。

Any move to take the institute off the list is likely to met with objections by some U.S. lawmakers and rights groups concerned about China’s treatment of Uyghurs. Republican Senator Marsha Blackburn said such a move would be "unconscionable."翻译:任何将该研究所从名单上除名的举动都可能会遭到一些美国议员和人权组织的反对，他们担心中国对待维吾尔人的方式。共和党参议员玛莎·布莱克本表示，此举“不合理”。

"The Xi regime is in economic trouble, and it needs America to rescue it. Instead, Biden should ramp up the pressure by imposing severe sanctions on China and keep the current sanctions in place," Blackburn said in a statement on Tuesday.翻译:布莱克本周二在一份声明中表示，“习近平政权陷入经济困境，需要美国来救助。相反，拜登应该加大压力，对中国实施严厉制裁，并维持目前的制裁。”

China's embassy in Washington did not immediately respond to a request for comment on the fentanyl issue.翻译:中国驻华盛顿大使馆没有立即回应就芬太尼问题发表评论的请求。

Fentanyl is up to 50 times stronger than heroin and is increasingly mixed with other illicit drugs, often with lethal results. U.S. drug-related overdose deaths surpassed 100,000 in 2021, according to government estimates.翻译:芬太尼的浓度比海洛因强 50 倍，并且越来越多地与其他非法药物混合，往往会造成致命的结果。据政府估计，2021 年美国因吸毒过量死亡人数超过 10 万人。

item.title: 英国首相巴德诺克将在APEC会议期间出席跨太平洋跨太平洋伙伴关系协定（CPTPP）会议
item.description:
British Business and Trade Secretary Kemi Badenoch plans to attend a meeting of a major trans-Pacific trade pact, which does not include the United States, on the sidelines of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation summit in San Francisco.翻译:英国商业和贸易大臣凯米·巴德诺克计划在旧金山亚太经济合作组织峰会期间参加一项不包括美国在内的主要跨太平洋贸易协定会议。

It will be Britain's first attendance at a meeting of the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP) after London signed up to the massive trade bloc in New Zealand in July, a UK official told Reuters.翻译:一位英国官员告诉路透社，这将是英国自七月份在新西兰签署全面且先进的跨太平洋伙伴关系协定（CPTPP）后首次出席会议。

U.S. officials had no immediate information about the CPTPP meeting, saying that Washington had not been invited.翻译:美国官员目前还没有关于 CPTPP 会议的消息，称华盛顿并未受到邀请。

CPTPP is a free trade agreement sealed in 2018 between 11 countries - Australia, Brunei, Canada, Chile, Japan, Malaysia, Mexico, New Zealand, Peru, Singapore and Vietnam - after the former Trump administration withdrew the United States from the proposed Trans-Pacific Partnership (TPP). Britain is the only European member of CPTPP and the first new country to join since it was created in 2018.翻译:CPTPP是在前特朗普政府让美国退出拟议的跨太平洋伙伴关系协定后，澳大利亚、文莱、加拿大、智利、日本、马来西亚、墨西哥、新西兰、秘鲁、新加坡和越南等11个国家于2018年签署的自由贸易协定。太平洋伙伴关系协定（TPP）。英国是CPTPP唯一的欧洲成员国，也是自2018年CPTPP成立以来第一个新加入的国家。

"Joining CPTPP will link the UK to some of the world's most dynamic economies, a club that is worth 12 trillion pounds ($14.99 trillion) of gross domestic product," the official added.翻译:这位官员补充道：“加入CPTPP将把英国与世界上一些最具活力的经济体联系起来，这个俱乐部的国内生产总值价值12万亿英镑（14.99万亿美元）。”

Details about the CPTPP meeting and which countries will participate were not immediately available.翻译:有关 CPTPP 会议以及哪些国家将参加的详细信息尚未立即公布。

To date, China, Costa Rica, Ecuador and Taiwan have applied to join the trade pact, and South Korea, Thailand, and Ukraine are also considering membership.翻译:迄今为止，中国、哥斯达黎加、厄瓜多尔和台湾已申请加入该贸易协定，韩国、泰国和乌克兰也在考虑加入。

The United States has said it is not interested in joining the trade bloc, despite calls from some lawmakers to sign up. Washington is advancing its own initiative, the Indo-Pacific Economic Framework for Prosperity (IPEF).翻译:尽管一些立法者呼吁加入，但美国已表示无意加入该贸易集团。华盛顿正在推进自己的倡议，即印度-太平洋繁荣经济框架（IPEF）。

($1 = 0.8006 pounds)翻译:（1 美元 = 0.8006 英镑）

item.title: 墨西哥总统将在旧金山峰会上会见中国习近平
item.description:
Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador will meet with his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping on Thursday in San Francisco during an Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) summit, Mexico's foreign minister said on Tuesday.翻译:墨西哥外交部长周二表示，墨西哥总统安德烈斯·曼努埃尔·洛佩斯·奥夫拉多尔将于周四在旧金山亚太经合组织（APEC）峰会期间会见中国国家主席习近平。

Lopez Obrador, who seldom travels outside Mexico, is also scheduled to meet with U.S. President Joe Biden the following day on the sidelines of the APEC meetings.翻译:很少出墨西哥旅行的洛佩兹·奥夫拉多尔也计划于第二天在亚太经合组织会议期间与美国总统乔·拜登会面。

Mexican Foreign Minister Alicia Barcena told a press conference that Lopez Obrador and Xi would discuss trade as well as how to improve bilateral supply chains for what she said would be their first meeting in person.翻译:墨西哥外交部长阿丽西亚·巴尔塞纳在新闻发布会上表示，洛佩斯·奥夫拉多尔和习近平将讨论贸易以及如何改善双边供应链，她说这将是他们的第一次亲自会面。

"It's a very important meeting," said Barcena, noting that China had always wanted close relations with Mexico.翻译:巴尔塞纳说：“这是一次非常重要的会议。”他指出，中国一直希望与墨西哥建立密切的关系。

Barcena said Mexico's economic relations with the United States would be at the heart of the U.S.-Mexico talks, pointing to billions of dollars in U.S. investment coming to Mexico.翻译:巴尔塞纳表示，墨西哥与美国的经济关系将是美墨谈判的核心，并指出美国将向墨西哥投资数十亿美元。

Immigration and border security, as well as efforts to curb drug trafficking would also be prominent, she said, noting the two sides would look at how to better control the arrival of precursors from Asia used to make deadly opioid fentanyl.翻译:她说，移民和边境安全以及遏制毒品贩运的努力也将是重点，并指出双方将研究如何更好地控制来自亚洲的用于制造致命阿片类芬太尼的前体的抵达。

Barcena said Lopez Obrador would also hold a bilateral meeting with Canada on Thursday afternoon, without being more specific. A Mexican official said the meeting would be with Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau.翻译:巴萨纳表示，洛佩斯·奥夫拉多尔也将于周四下午与加拿大举行双边会议，但没有透露更多具体信息。一名墨西哥官员表示，会议将与加拿大总理贾斯汀·特鲁多举行。

item.title: 拜登称习主席会晤的目标是恢复正常沟通
item.description:
U.S. President Joe Biden said on Tuesday his goal during talks with Chinese President Xi Jinping this week is to resume normal communications between the two superpowers, including military-to-military contacts.翻译:美国总统乔·拜登周二表示，他本周与中国国家主席习近平会谈的目标是恢复两个超级大国之间的正常沟通，包括军事接触。

Speaking to reporters after remarks on climate change at the White House, Biden said he is trying to change the U.S. relationship with China for the better, after a period of strained ties. The two leaders meet on Wednesday in the San Francisco area.翻译:拜登在白宫就气候变化发表讲话后对记者表示，在经历了一段时间的紧张关系后，他正在努力让美中关系变得更好。两位领导人周三在旧金山地区会面。

item.title: 尽管降低了风险，中国企业仍看到欧盟的前景——调查
item.description:
Most Chinese companies operating in the European Union are feeling a pinch from the bloc's de-risking strategy, but still see more opportunity than challenge in Europe's green and digital transitions, according to a survey published on Tuesday.翻译:周二发布的一项调查显示，大多数在欧盟经营的中国企业都感受到了欧盟去风险战略的压力，但在欧洲的绿色和数字化转型中，机遇仍然多于挑战。

The survey for the China Chamber of Commerce to the EU, conducted by consultants Roland Berger, gauged the views of 180 Chinese enterprises in the EU, including telecoms and smartphone companies Huawei (HWT.UL) and ZTE (000063.SZ), electric vehicle maker BYD(002594.SZ), COSCO Shipping and China's largest banks.翻译:罗兰贝格咨询公司为欧盟中国商会进行的这项调查收集了180家在欧盟中国企业的观点，其中包括电信和智能手机公司华为（HWT.UL）和中兴通讯（000063.SZ） 、电动汽车制造商比亚迪（002594.SZ） 、中远海运和中国最大的银行。

Their overall rating of the EU's business environment fell for the fourth consecutive year, with views of the political landscape declining most steeply.翻译:他们对欧盟商业环境的总体评级连续第四年下降，其中对政治格局的看法下降幅度最大。

Some 72% of respondents said their business operations had been negatively impacted by the EU's de-risking strategy, particularly semiconductor and telecoms suppliers. The strategy partly seeks to reduce EU dependence on China, especially for minerals and products required for its green and digital transitions.翻译:约 72% 的受访者表示，他们的业务运营受到了欧盟去风险战略的负面影响，特别是半导体和电信供应商。该战略的部分目的是减少欧盟对中国的依赖，特别是在绿色和数字化转型所需的矿产和产品方面。

China processes nearly 90% of rare earth elements and 60% of lithium globally and has announced export restrictions for other key materials - gallium, germanium and graphite.翻译:中国加工了全球近90%的稀土元素和60%的锂，并宣布对其他关键材料——镓、锗和石墨——进行出口限制。

A number of Chinese companies felt the EU had become more unfair in terms of single market access, import tariffs, public procurement opportunities and scrutiny of investments. The EU is also looking into possible tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles.翻译:许多中国企业认为欧盟在单一市场准入、进口关税、公共采购机会和投资审查方面变得更加不公平。欧盟也在研究可能对中国电动汽车征收的关税。

However, despite these challenges, 83% of respondent companies said they still had faith in the EU market and would continue to expand their presence.翻译:然而，尽管面临这些挑战，83%的受访企业表示，他们仍然对欧盟市场充满信心，并将继续扩大业务。

On the EU's transition to a greener and more digital economy, most companies expressed optimism that China-EU cooperation and technology collaboration would intensify in the coming years.翻译:对于欧盟向更绿色、更数字化的经济转型，大多数企业对未来几年中欧合作和技术协作将加强表示乐观。

About 90% replied that they saw more opportunities than challenges in green and digital fields.翻译:约90%的人回答说，他们在绿色和数字领域看到的机遇多于挑战。

The report also noted that bilateral trade was continuing to grow, reaching 857 billion euros ($917 billion) in 2022, making the EU and China each other's second-largest trading partner.翻译:报告还指出，双边贸易持续增长，到2022年将达到8570亿欧元（9170亿美元），使欧盟和中国互为第二大贸易伙伴。

The EU has said it wants a more balanced relationship with China and that its trade deficit of about 400 billion euros is partly due to Chinese restrictions on European companies compared with an EU market that is largely open.翻译:欧盟表示希望与中国建立更加平衡的关系，其约4000亿欧元的贸易逆差部分是由于中国对欧洲企业的限制，而欧盟市场基本上是开放的。

($1 = 0.9343 euros)翻译:（1 美元 = 0.9343 欧元）

item.title: 在公众强烈反对后，泰国放弃与中国警方的联合巡逻
item.description:
Thailand rolled back on Tuesday plans of joint patrols with Chinese police in popular tourist spots after public backlash.翻译:在公众强烈反对后，泰国周二取消了与中国警方在热门旅游景点联合巡逻的计划。

Tourism officials on Sunday floated the idea of having Chinese and Thai police patrol much-visited areas to build confidence among tourists, including Chinese nationals.翻译:周日，旅游官员提出了让中国和泰国警察在游客较多的地区巡逻的想法，以建立包括中国公民在内的游客的信心。

The plan, however, sparked uproar online, drawing criticism that it compromised national sovereignty, and a rebuke from the country's police chief.翻译:然而，该计划在网上引发轩然大波，批评其损害国家主权，并遭到该国警察局长的斥责。

"There are many alternative ways to build confidence for tourists in Thailand ... but we will not have joint patrols," Tourism Minister Sudawan Wangsuphakijkosol told reporters on Tuesday.翻译:“有很多替代方法可以为泰国游客建立信心……但我们不会进行联合巡逻，”旅游部长苏达万·旺苏帕基科索尔 (Sudawan Wangsuphakijkosol) 周二告诉记者。

"The Thai police force is already adequate and are working hard to restore confidence," Sudawan said.翻译:苏达万说：“泰国警察力量已经足够，正在努力恢复信心。”

Thai authorities have rushed to tighten security after last month's shooting spree at a luxury mall in Bangkok in which two people, including one Chinese national, were killed, fanned safety concerns.翻译:上个月，曼谷一家豪华购物中心发生枪击事件，造成两人死亡，其中包括一名中国公民，引发安全担忧，泰国当局迅速加强安保。

Restoring confidence is critical for Thailand's tourism industry, especially among Chinese visitors.翻译:恢复信心对于泰国旅游业，尤其是中国游客来说至关重要。

They accounted for 11 million out of record 39.9 million foreign tourist arrivals in Thailand in 2019, but their return after the COVID-19 pandemic has been sluggish, prompting the government in September to waive visa requirements for Chinese nationals.翻译:2019 年，泰国入境外国游客达到创纪录的 3,990 万人次，其中 1,100 万人次是中国游客，但在新冠肺炎 (COVID-19) 大流行之后，他们的回归一直缓慢，促使泰国政府于 9 月免除了对中国公民的签证要求。

So far this year, Thailand has welcomed 23.2 million foreign arrivals.翻译:今年迄今，泰国已接待外国游客2320万人次。

item.title: 高管被捕如何对日中业务造成打击
item.description:
If Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida meets Chinese President Xi Jinping for the first time in a year later this week, he will likely raise the case of a detained company executive that has dealt an outsized blow to their close economic ties.翻译:如果日本首相岸田文雄本周晚些时候一年内首次会见中国国家主席习近平，他可能会提出一名被拘留的公司高管的案件，该案对两国密切的经济关系造成了巨大打击。

The employee of drugmaker Astellas Pharma (4503.T), as well as other Japanese imprisoned or under criminal probes in China, would probably be among the topics to be discussed as plans take shape for the leaders to talk on the sidelines of the APEC summit in San Francisco, sources familiar with the planning said.翻译:制药商安斯泰来制药(Astellas Pharma, 4503.T)的员工，以及其他在中国被监禁或接受刑事调查的日本人，可能会成为领导人在APEC 峰会期间谈话的计划中讨论的话题之一熟悉该计划的消息人士称，在旧金山。

The arrest of the well-connected veteran of the Japanese community in China has had what some Tokyo officials described as a considerable chilling effect on business, contributing to a drop in foreign investment to its lowest level since at least 2014 and accelerating an exodus of expats.翻译:一些东京官员称，这名在中国的日本人社区中人脉广泛的资深人士被捕，对企业产生了相当大的寒蝉效应，导致外国投资降至至少 2014 年以来的最低水平，并加速了外籍人士的外流。

"I know Japanese businesses are rethinking," Rahm Emanuel, the U.S. ambassador to Japan, told Reuters in an interview. "Right now, you can't get people to go staff the companies in China because they're scared of their own safety."翻译:美国驻日本大使拉姆·伊曼纽尔在接受路透社采访时表示：“我知道日本企业正在重新考虑。” “现在，你无法让人们去中国的公司工作，因为他们担心自己的安全。”

China detained the executive, named in several media reports as Hiroshi Nishiyama, on suspicion of espionage in March, and he was formally arrested last month. Japan's then foreign minister protested the executive's detention with his Chinese counterpart on a visit to Beijing in April.翻译:中国于三月份以涉嫌间谍罪拘留了这位在多家媒体报道中被称为西山宏的高管，并于上个月被正式逮捕。时任日本外务大臣在四月访问北京时向中国外长提出抗议，抗议这名高管被拘留。

There has been no official confirmation that Kishida and Xi will hold a meeting, which some Japanese news outlets have said is being prepared for Thursday.翻译:目前还没有官方证实岸田和习近平将举行会面，一些日本新闻媒体表示正在为周四的会面做准备。

A spokesperson for Japan's foreign ministry said in an emailed statement that Tokyo had repeatedly urged Beijing at various levels to repatriate Japanese nationals detained in China and to ensure transparency in the judicial process.翻译:日本外务省发言人在一份电子邮件声明中表示，东京已多次敦促北京各级遣返在中国被拘留的日本公民，并确保司法程序的透明度。

"Although nothing has been decided on future Japan-China bilateral summit meetings, including on the occasion of the APEC summit meeting to be held this week, we will continue to urge the Chinese side to do so," Masashi Mizobuchi, assistant press secretary at the ministry, said.翻译:日本媒体助理新闻秘书沟渕正志表示：“虽然未来的日中双边峰会，包括本周即将举行的亚太经合组织峰会，尚未做出任何决定，但我们将继续敦促中方这样做。”该部表示。

China's foreign ministry said in a statement: "China has always supported China-Japan trade and economic cooperation, and provides a good environment for the lawful operation of Japanese companies in China and their employees."

RISKY BUSINESS

Five Japanese nationals are currently detained in China with a total of 17 detained since 2015, the year after China's anti-espionage law went into effect, according to Japan's foreign ministry.翻译:日本外务省表示，目前有 5 名日本公民在中国被拘留，自 2015 年（中国反间谍法生效次年）以来，共有 17 人被拘留。

But the arrest of Nishiyama hit a nerve partly because of the timing - coming during a sweeping national security crackdown and because of the executive's high profile.翻译:但西山的被捕触动了人们的神经，部分原因是时机—— 正值大规模的国家安全镇压期间，以及这位高管的高调。

Nishiyama, a fluent Mandarin speaker and former board member of the Japanese Chamber of Commerce in China, attended several high-profile events with officials from both countries in recent years.翻译:西山能说一口流利的普通话，也是中国日本商会前董事会成员，近年来与两国官员一起出席了多次备受瞩目的活动。

He often spoke about his connections to officialdom, two people who knew him said on condition of anonymity.翻译:两位不愿透露姓名的认识他的人士表示，他经常谈论自己与官场的关系。

Because of Nishiyama's status, his arrest had symbolic importance, according to five Japanese government officials, who also spoke on condition of anonymity due to the sensitivity of the case.翻译:五名日本政府官员表示，由于西山的身份，他的被捕具有象征意义。由于案件敏感性，这些官员也要求匿名。

The officials said that since his detention there has been a sharp uptick in questions from business people asking if it is safe to travel to China, while some Japanese companies in China have been telling employees to keep a low profile and not push too hard in sales and other activities.翻译:官员们表示，自他被拘留以来，商界人士询问前往中国是否安全的问题急剧增加，而一些在华日本公司则一直告诉员工要保持低调，不要在销售上太卖力。和其他活动。

"People are worried that they may be arrested suddenly when they go to China," Takeshi Niinami, chairman of the Japan Association of Corporate Executives, told a news conference last month.翻译:日本企业高管协会会长新波武史在上个月的新闻发布会上表示：“人们担心他们去中国时可能会突然被捕。”

"Considering the current situation in China, it is very difficult to create an atmosphere that encourages people to do something new," said Niinami, who is also the CEO of drinks giant Suntory.

DIFFICULT DECISIONS

In the first nine months of this year, Japan's net foreign direct investment (FDI) into mainland China slumped 30.6% on the year to 393.4 billion yen ($2.6 billion), even as its total worldwide FDI grew by nearly a fifth, according to ministry of finance data.翻译:日本经济部表示，今年前 9 个月，日本对中国大陆的外国直接投资净额 (FDI) 同比下降 30.6%，至 3,934 亿日元（26 亿美元），尽管其全球 FDI 总额增长了近五分之一的财务数据。

That is the lowest amount for the period going back to at least 2014 when the data series begins.翻译:这是至少可以追溯到 2014 年数据系列开始以来的最低金额。

Half the respondents in a recent survey of Japanese companies doing business in China said they would cut investments this year. Only 10% of the 8,300 firms said they would increase investments, according to the inaugural poll by the Japanese Chamber of Commerce in China published last month.翻译:最近一项针对在中国开展业务的日本企业的调查显示，一半受访者表示今年将削减投资。中国日本商会上个月发布的首次民意调查显示，8,300家企业中只有10%表示将增加投资。

The reasons for caution given by respondents included sluggish demand, cross border regulation and "concerns about the risk of investment in China at head office".翻译:受访者给出的谨慎理由包括需求低迷、跨境监管以及“总部对中国投资风险的担忧”。

Alongside the U.S., China is Japan's biggest trade partner, and a major unwind of that relationship is not on the immediate horizon, economists say.翻译:经济学家表示，中国与美国一样是日本最大的贸易伙伴，而且这种关系短期内不会出现大幅缓解。

But finding Japanese to staff offices in China could become more of a problem for Japanese firms.翻译:但对于日本公司来说，在中国的办事处寻找日本人可能会成为一个更大的问题。

The number of Japanese living in China has been on a steady decline over the last decade and totalled 102,066 in 2022, according to data collected by Japan's foreign ministry. A similar drop this year would mark the lowest number of expats there since at least 2004.翻译:日本外务省收集的数据显示，过去十年来，居住在中国的日本人数量持续下降，到 2022 年总数将达到 102,066 人。今年的类似下降将标志着至少自 2004 年以来的最低外籍人士数量。

A real estate agent in Beijing, speaking on condition of anonymity, said the Astellas case had a "huge impact" on his Japanese clients with people refusing assignments in China or their families opposing the moves because they are "scared" about getting in legal trouble.翻译:北京一位不愿透露姓名的房地产经纪人表示，安斯泰来案对他的日本客户产生了“巨大影响”，一些人拒绝在中国派遣工作，或者他们的家人反对此举，因为他们“害怕”陷入法律麻烦。

Stefan Angrick, a senior economist for Moody's Analytics based in Tokyo, said even some of the most pro-China business executives in Japan are now wary of security risks there.翻译:东京穆迪分析公司高级经济学家斯蒂芬·安格里克表示，即使是一些最亲中国的日本企业高管现在也对那里的安全风险保持警惕。

"Japan and China are two economies that are deeply intertwined with one another and are incredibly important for one another. It's a very difficult point in time to be navigating that as a decision maker, in business or politics," he said.翻译:“日本和中国是两个紧密相连的经济体，对彼此来说都极其重要。作为商业或政治决策者，现在是一个非常困难的时刻，”他说。

($1 = 151.7200 yen)翻译:（1 美元 = 151.7200 日元）

Reporting by Yukiko Toyoda, Kiyoshi Takenaka, John Geddie, Sakura Murakami and Francis Tang in Tokyo; Laurie Chen and Antoni Slodkowski in Beijing; and Andrew Silver in Shanghai; Writing by John Geddie; Editing by Lincoln Feast and Alexander Smith翻译:丰田由纪子、竹中清、约翰·格迪、村上樱和弗朗西斯·唐在东京的报道； Laurie Chen 和 Antoni Slodkowski 在北京；和安德鲁·西尔弗 (Andrew Silver) 在上海；约翰·格迪撰写；林肯·法斯特和亚历山大·史密斯编辑

item.title: 独家：随着债务风险上升，中国要求地方政府削减公私合营项目的投资
item.description:
China has ordered its local governments to halt public-private partnership projects identified as "problematic" and replaced a 10% budget spending allowance for these ventures with a vetting mechanism by Beijing as it tries to curb municipal debt risks.翻译:中国已下令地方政府停止被认定为“有问题”的公私合作项目，并用北京的审查机制取代了对这些项目的10%预算支出补贴，以试图遏制市政债务风险。

The guidelines were mentioned in a cabinet document that was circulated among local governments, policy banks and state lenders last month, said the two sources with knowledge of the matter. The latest guidelines have not been reported previously.翻译:两位知情人士表示，上个月在地方政府、政策性银行和国有银行之间分发的一份内阁文件中提到了这些指导方针。此前并未报道过最新的指导方针。

The State Council has issued detailed guidelines to reform the public-private partnership (PPP) model for the first time since its launch in 2014, and comes as worries grow about the impact of ballooning local government debt on the economy.翻译:自2014年推出以来，国务院首次发布了政府和社会资本合作（PPP）模式改革的详细指导方针，与此同时，人们越来越担心地方政府债务不断膨胀对经济的影响。

Local government debt reached 92 trillion yuan ($12.6 trillion), or 76% of China's economic output in 2022, up from 62.2% in 2019, according to the latest data from the International Monetary Fund.翻译:根据国际货币基金组织的最新数据，到2022年，地方政府债务将达到92万亿元人民币（12.6万亿美元），占中国经济产出的76%，高于2019年的62.2%。

In an effort to constrain the accumulation of further debt, Beijing will eliminate a regulation allowing local governments to earmark up to 10% of their annual public budget expenditures toward these projects, the sources said.翻译:消息人士称，为了限制债务进一步积累，北京将取消一项允许地方政府将最多 10% 的年度公共预算支出用于这些项目的规定。

The 10% expenditure threshold will now be replaced with government authorities' review of each PPP project, they said. The move comes after numerous local governments' PPP expenditure hit the upper limit of the threshold in recent years.翻译:他们表示，10%的支出门槛现在将由政府当局对每个 PPP 项目的审查所取代。此举是在近年来不少地方政府PPP支出触及门槛上限之后做出的。

The State Council also asked the local governments to halt "problematic projects", identified in inspections conducted by the National Audit Office (NAO) earlier this year, and address the identified issues, said the sources.翻译:消息人士称，国务院还要求地方政府停止审计署今年早些时候检查中发现的“问题项目”，并解决发现的问题。

Projects designated as "problematic" are those riddled with irregularities including in which local government financing vehicles (LGFVs) posed as the "private" partner, spurring excessive debt accumulation, one of the sources said.翻译:其中一位消息人士称，被认定为“有问题”的项目是那些充满违规行为的项目，其中包括地方政府融资平台（LGFV）冒充“私人”合作伙伴，刺激债务过度积累。

In addition to those measures, all PPP projects that have not finished bidding process to find partners by February this year will have to be suspended, said the two sources, who have direct knowledge of the State Council document.翻译:两位直接了解国务院文件的消息人士表示，除了这些措施外，今年 2 月之前尚未完成招标寻找合作伙伴的所有 PPP 项目都将不得不暂停。

Since 2014, Beijing has promoted a PPP model to channel private money into public infrastructure projects, to increase capital investment while easing the burden on heavily-indebted local governments.翻译:2014年以来，北京推广PPP模式，引导民间资金参与公共基础设施项目，增加资本投入，同时减轻负债累累的地方政府负担。

But the PPP boom has alarmed authorities who say some local governments have used public-private partnerships, government investment funds and government procurement services as "disguised channels" for raising debt.翻译:但PPP热潮引起了当局的警惕，他们表示，一些地方政府利用公私合作伙伴关系、政府投资基金和政府采购服务作为筹集债务的“变相渠道”。

Both the sources declined to be named due to sensitivity of the matter.翻译:由于此事的敏感性，两位消息人士均拒绝透露姓名。

The State Council and the NAO did not immediately respond to Reuters requests for comments.

CURBING RISKS

Debt-laden local governments represent a major risk to the Chinese economy and its financial stability, economists say, amid a deepening property crisis, years of over-investment in infrastructure and huge bills to contain the COVID-19 pandemic.翻译:经济学家表示，在房地产危机不断加深、基础设施建设多年过度投资以及遏制新冠肺炎 (COVID-19) 疫情的巨额支出的背景下，负债累累的地方政府对中国经济及其金融稳定构成了重大风险。

A portion of the $12.6 trillion local government debt is linked to the PPP projects, as municipalities used these infrastructure-building initiatives as a conduit to raise capital.翻译:12.6 万亿美元的地方政府债务中有一部分与 PPP 项目相关，因为市政当局利用这些基础设施建设举措作为筹集资金的渠道。

As of the end-2022, China had implemented more than 14,000 PPP projects with the value of investment worth 20.9 trillion yuan ($2.87 trillion), or roughly the size of France's economy, according to a research note by Bank of China.翻译:中国银行的一份研究报告显示，截至2022年底，中国已实施了超过14,000个PPP项目，投资价值达20.9万亿元人民币（2.87万亿美元），大致相当于法国经济规模。

Beijing is now stepping up efforts to minimise the broader economic risk posed by the local government debt.翻译:北京目前正在加紧努力，尽量减少地方政府债务带来的更广泛的经济风险。

Reuters reported last month, citing sources with knowledge of the matter, that China has told state-owned banks to roll over existing local government debt with longer-term loans at lower interest rates.翻译:路透社上个月援引知情人士的话报道称，中国已要求国有银行以较低利率以长期贷款展期现有地方政府债务。

The National Development and Reform Commission (NDRC), the top planner, and the finance ministry last week issued rules to encourage private firms to invest in PPP programs and allow them to take controlling stakes in some of those projects.翻译:国家发展和改革委员会（国家发改委）和财政部上周发布了规则，鼓励私营企业投资 PPP 项目，并允许它们在其中一些项目中控股。

The State Council document said that the oversight for PPP projects, such as vetting return-on-investment assessments and fiscal stress testing, will shift from the finance ministry to the NDRC, according to the sources.翻译:消息人士称，国务院文件称，PPP项目的投资回报评估审核和财政压力测试等监管职责将从财政部转移到国家发改委。

The finance ministry and the NDRC also did not respond to Reuters request for comment.翻译:财政部和国家发改委也没有回应路透社的置评请求。

Local governments are required to report all PPP projects to the State Council and the NDRC by November, the first source said, adding the municipalities are encouraged to issue special-purpose or general bonds to repay debt tied to the projects.翻译:第一位消息人士称，地方政府必须在 11 月之前向国务院和国家发改委报告所有 PPP 项目，并鼓励各市发行专项或一般债券来偿还与项目相关的债务。

($1 = 7.2927 Chinese yuan renminbi)翻译:（1 美元 = 7.2927 人民币）

item.title: 中国毕业生推迟职业梦想，从事临时政府工作
item.description:
Having failed to find his dream job at a Chinese internet company upon graduation, Peter Liu settled for a role in a state library where there is so little need for his participation that he spends his time studying for a change in his career path.翻译:毕业后，彼得·刘(Peter Liu)未能在一家中国互联网公司找到自己梦想的工作，他最终在一家州立图书馆找到了一份工作，那里几乎不需要他参与，所以他把时间花在了学习上，以期改变自己的职业道路。

"It's really hard to get work at big companies," said the 24-year-old who majored in TV production at a Beijing university before moving back home in the central Henan province.翻译:“在大公司找到工作真的很难，”这位 24 岁的年轻人说，他在北京一所大学主修电视制作，后来搬回了位于中部河南省的老家。

Liu got the librarian job after a government-led campaign to secure temporary work for graduates, which analysts describe as a short-term solution to preserve social stability in a slowing economy with little on offer for young Chinese.翻译:刘在政府主导的一场为毕业生争取临时工作的运动后获得了图书馆员的职位，分析人士称，这是在经济放缓、中国年轻人几乎没有什么机会的情况下维护社会稳定的短期解决方案。

Such "welfare jobs," as they are known in China, include roles as receptionists, office administrators, security guards and community workers. Various government institutions offer such jobs every year, but they had usually drawn applications from disadvantaged groups, such as elderly or disabled people.翻译:这些在中国被称为“福利工作”的岗位包括接待员、办公室管理员、保安和社区工作人员。各个政府机构每年都会提供此类工作，但通常都是从弱势群体（例如老年人或残疾人）中吸引申请。

This year, amid a deepening youth joblessness crisis in the world's second-largest economy, even remote rural positions have seen intense competition from young Chinese with diplomas from top universities, graduates and economists say.翻译:毕业生和经济学家表示，今年，在世界第二大经济体青年失业危机日益加深的情况下，即使是偏远的农村职位也面临着来自拥有顶尖大学文凭的中国年轻人的激烈竞争。

The government sees employment as key to pacifying China's most pessimistic generation in decades, while graduates gaining even limited work experience can also benefit their future employers if the economy recovers, analysts say.翻译:分析人士表示，政府认为就业是安抚中国数十年来最悲观一代的关键，而如果经济复苏，即使毕业生获得有限的工作经验也能让他们未来的雇主受益。

The one-to-three year contracts pay roughly the minimum wage in the region, typically between 2,000 and 3,000 yuan ($275-$412) per month, sometimes including free meals - much less than their average expectation for a first job salary of 8,033 yuan, according to a survey by Chinese recruitment firm Liepin.翻译:一到三年的合同支付的工资大致相当于该地区的最低工资，通常为每月 2,000 至 3,000 元（275 至 412 美元），有时包括免费餐 - 远低于他们对第一份工作 8,033 元的平均预期工资根据中国招聘公司猎聘的一项调查。

A separate programme aiming for 1 million internships this year has courted state-owned and private firms for participation.翻译:一项旨在今年提供 100 万个实习机会的单独计划吸引了国有和私营公司参与。

The Ministry of Human Resources and Social Security, which did not reply to a request for comment on the government programmes or the job market, told state media last week youth employment was improving.翻译:人力资源和社会保障部没有回复对政府计划或就业市场发表评论的请求，但上周对官方媒体表示，青年就业正在改善。

China has in the past year eased some regulatory burdens on tech, property and finance firms - traditionally large employers of new talent. But state media editorials have also encouraged young graduates to take lower skilled jobs.翻译:去年，中国减轻了科技、房地产和金融公司的一些监管负担，这些公司历来是新人才的大雇主。但官方媒体的社论也鼓励年轻毕业生从事技术含量较低的工作。

On Wednesday, the statistics bureau is expected to omit for the fourth consecutive month the release of youth unemployment data, suspended in July after reaching a record 21.3% in June, just as 11.6 million fresh graduates were entering the job market.翻译:周三，预计统计局将连续第四个月省略青年失业率数据的发布，该数据在 6 月份达到创纪录的 21.3% 后于 7 月份暂停发布，当时正值 1,160 万应届毕业生进入就业市场。

The total take-up of short-term jobs and internships remains unknown, but social media posts commenting on the selection process and discussing career options are frequent and analysts expect such roles will be in demand in a slowing economy.翻译:短期工作和实习的总人数仍不得而知，但社交媒体上经常出现评论甄选过程和讨论职业选择的帖子，分析师预计，在经济放缓的情况下，此类职位将会很受欢迎。

Still, the state sector - which provides a fifth of the urban jobs in China - can only temporarily alleviate economic pressure for a portion of university graduates through such campaigns, economists say, warning youth unemployment remains a major long-term headache for Beijing.翻译:尽管如此，经济学家表示，国有部门——提供了中国五分之一的城镇就业机会——只能通过此类运动暂时缓解部分大学毕业生的经济压力，并警告说，青年失业问题仍然是令北京方面长期头疼的一个主要问题。

"Youth unemployment will stay with us for quite a long time, at least for five-to-10 years," said Wang Jun, chief economist at Huatai Asset Management, adding the temporary jobs are "a short-term fix for stability, to relieve social conflicts brought by joblessness."翻译:华泰资产管理公司首席经济学家王军表示：“青年失业问题将在相当长的一段时间内困扰我们，至少会持续五到十年。”他补充说，临时就业岗位是“稳定稳定的短期解决方案”。缓解失业带来的社会矛盾。”

China had witnessed high youth unemployment in the late 1970s and early 1980s as educated youth returned to cities after working the farmlands under Mao Zedong, as well as in the late 1990s when the country began shrinking inefficient state conglomerates.翻译:在20世纪70年代末和1980年代初，随着知青在毛泽东领导下的农田工作后返回城市，以及在90年代末，当中国开始收缩效率低下的国有企业时，中国青年失业率居高不下。

A 23-year-old graduate surnamed Chen said she beat more than a dozen applicants in August to a secretary job at a local agriculture centre in the southwestern city of Chongqing.翻译:一名 23 岁的陈姓毕业生表示，8 月份，她击败了十几名应聘者，在西南部城市重庆的当地农业中心找到了一份秘书工作。

"The gap between my dreams and reality is huge," said Chen, who wanted to become a teacher.翻译:“我的梦想和现实之间的差距很大，”想成为一名教师的陈说。

Chen and Liu are both using the slow days at work to study for the highly-competitive 2024 civil service exam, which drew a record 2.6 million applicants, according to state media. If they pass, they would start on one of the most coveted career paths in China, often referred to as the "iron bowl" of financial stability.翻译:据官方媒体报道，陈和刘都在利用工作中的空闲时间来学习竞争激烈的 2024 年公务员考试，这次考试吸引了创纪录的 260 万人报名。如果通过，他们将开始中国最令人向往的职业道路之一，通常被称为金融稳定的“铁碗”。

Liu never expected to go for a public sector career, but for now he is at least happy that he can take that chance.翻译:刘从未想过会从事公共部门的职业，但现在他至少很高兴自己能抓住这个机会。

"I don't want my parents to see me staying at home all day with nothing to do," said Liu.翻译:“我不想让父母看到我整天呆在家里无所事事，”刘说。

item.title: 拜登和中国习近平将在亚太经合组织峰会上讨论沟通和竞争
item.description:
The White House said on Monday President Joe Biden and Chinese President Xi Jinping will discuss strengthening communication and managing competition when they meet on the sidelines of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) summit this week.翻译:白宫周一表示，美国总统乔·拜登和中国国家主席习近平本周将在亚太经合组织（APEC）峰会期间会面，讨论加强沟通和管理竞争的问题。

The face-to-face meeting in the San Francisco Bay Area on Wednesday will be the first between Biden and Xi in a year, with the high-stakes diplomacy aimed at curbing tensions between the two superpowers.翻译:周三在旧金山湾区举行的面对面会晤将是拜登和习近平一年来的首次会面，此次高风险外交旨在遏制两个超级大国之间的紧张关系。

White House national security adviser Jake Sullivan told reporters Biden believes there is no substitute for face-to-face diplomacy to manage the complex relationship.翻译:白宫国家安全顾问杰克·沙利文告诉记者，拜登认为，在处理复杂的关系方面，面对面的外交是无可替代的。

"We anticipate that the leaders will discuss some of the most fundamental elements of the U.S.-PRC bilateral relationship, including the continued importance of strengthening open lines of communication and managing competition responsibly so that it does not veer into conflict," Sullivan said, referring to the People's Republic of China.翻译:沙利文表示：“我们预计领导人将讨论美中双边关系的一些最基本要素，包括加强开放的沟通渠道和负责任地管理竞争以使其不会演变成冲突的持续重要性。”至中华人民共和国。

"The way we achieve that is through intense diplomacy. That's how we clear up misperceptions and avoid surprises."翻译:“我们实现这一目标的方法是通过激烈的外交。这就是我们消除误解并避免意外的方法。”

Sullivan said Biden would go into the summit "on a solid footing," having positioned the United States to be able to compete effectively at home and abroad and with "the strongest recovery and lowest inflation of any leading economy."翻译:沙利文表示，拜登将以“坚实的基础”参加峰会，使美国能够在国内外进行有效竞争，并实现“所有主要经济体中最强劲的复苏和最低的通胀”。

He said Washington is looking for specific outcomes from the meeting and hoped to see progress in reestablishing military-to military ties with China and in combating the trade in fentanyl that has become a scourge in the United States.翻译:他表示，华盛顿正在寻求此次会议的具体成果，并希望看到在与中国重建军事关系以及打击已成为美国祸害的芬太尼贸易方面取得进展。

China cut off military-to-military communications with the United States last year after a visit to Taiwan, a democratically governed island China claims as its own, by then U.S. House speaker Nancy Pelosi. Tense relations soured further when the U.S. shot down U.S. spy balloon In February.翻译:去年，时任美国众议院议长南希·佩洛西访问台湾后，中国切断了与美国的军事联系。台湾是一个民主治理的岛屿，中国声称拥有自己的岛屿。当美国二月份击落美国间谍气球后，紧张关系进一步恶化。

Sullivan said communication between the militaries was the way to ensure competition did not veer into conflict and that China had been "constructive" on the issue in dialogue leading up to the summit.翻译:沙利文表示，军方之间的沟通是确保竞争不会演变成冲突的方式，并且中国在峰会前的对话中对此问题表现出“建设性”态度。

"We will see what happens in San Francisco and the President will be able to report after the meeting, whether in fact, we've made progress on restoring military-to-military links," he said.翻译:他说：“我们将看看旧金山会发生什么，总统将能够在会后报告，我们是否在恢复军事联系方面确实取得了进展。”

Biden and Xi have known each other for more than a decade and have shared hours of conversation over six interactions since Biden's 2021 inauguration.翻译:拜登和习近平已经相识十多年，自拜登 2021 年就职以来，双方已进行了六次互动，进行了数小时的交谈。

However, they have met only once in person since then and Xi has not visited the United States since 2017. Analysts and officials say they will come to the table in an atmosphere of mutual suspicion and garbled impressions of what the other is seeking.翻译:然而，自那以后，他们只见过一次面，而习近平自 2017 年以来就没有访问过美国。分析人士和官员表示，他们将在相互猜疑的气氛中进行会谈，并对对方的追求产生错误的印象。

The meeting is also expected to cover global issues from the Israel-Hamas war to Russia's invasion of Ukraine, North Korea's ties with Russia, Taiwan, human rights, artificial intelligence, as well as "fair" trade and economic relations, senior Biden administration officials said.翻译:拜登政府高级官员预计，此次会议还将涵盖以色列与哈马斯战争、俄罗斯入侵乌克兰、朝鲜与俄罗斯的关系、台湾、人权、人工智能以及“公平”贸易和经济关系等全球问题。说。

Sullivan said Biden would raise stability across the Middle East, adding that Beijing should share an interest in de-escalation there.翻译:沙利文表示，拜登将提高整个中东地区的稳定，并补充说，北京应该对缓和那里的局势感兴趣。

Biden would make the point that Iran acting in an "escalatory, destabilizing way" was not in the interests of China, he said. "And the PRC, of course, has a relationship with Iran, and it's capable, if it chooses, to of making those points directly to the Iranian government."翻译:他说，拜登将指出伊朗以“升级、破坏稳定的方式”行事不符合中国的利益。 “当然，中华人民共和国与伊朗有关系，如果它愿意的话，它有能力直接向伊朗政府提出这些观点。”

Leaders from the 21-member APEC forum are due to gather in San Francisco from Wednesday until Friday and the wars in the Middle East and Ukraine have divided opinion among them.翻译:由 21 个成员组成的亚太经合组织论坛的领导人定于周三至周五齐聚旧金山，中东和乌克兰的战争使他们意见分歧。

The senior U.S. official for APEC, Matt Murray, told reporters on Monday that the U.S. was working hard to try to get a strong consensus statement from the leaders, but analysts say the divisions make drafting this difficult.翻译:美国亚太经合组织高级官员马特·默里周一对记者表示，美国正在努力争取领导人达成强有力的共识声明，但分析人士表示，分歧使得起草过程变得困难。

Sullivan said that at APEC Biden would put forward his economic vision for the region and speak about "how the United States is the preeminent driver of inclusive, sustainable economic growth in the Asia Pacific."翻译:沙利文表示，拜登将在亚太经合组织上提出他对该地区的经济愿景，并谈到“美国如何成为亚太地区包容性、可持续经济增长的卓越推动者”。
